newsitem.title: CANADA: Some BHP diamond mine workers fall ill.
newsitem.headline: Some BHP diamond mine workers fall ill.

text.p: Forty-eight workers at the diamond mine being built by Broken Hill Proprietary Co Ltd in Canada's Arctic have fallen ill with gastrointestinal complaints over the past two weeks, the company said Friday.
BHP spokesman Graham Nicholls said the outbreak has not delayed work at the site. The complaints were minor and short-lived, he said.
The workers have been treated on site and rumors that the illnesses were serious and required air evacuation were not true, he said.

The cause of the illness is not known. Nicholls said possible causes included a flu virus or food poisoning. The company does not see the water supply as a likely cause but health officials are being brought in to investigate.
About 700 people are working at the site.
The company is developing the mine at Lac de Gras in the Northwest Territories with Dia Met Minerals Ltd and aims to put it into production in 1998.
